title: Centralize business phone/address and propagate to Contact + Footer

requirements.summary: Use `frontend/src/content/siteContent.ts` as the single source of truth for business phone and address, and ensure the Contact section renders them from `siteContent.contact`.
acceptanceCriteria: `siteContent.contact.phone` and `siteContent.contact.address` are the only values that need to be edited to change the phone/address shown in the Contact section.
`frontend/src/sections/ContactSection.tsx` continues to render the phone and address from `siteContent.contact` (no hardcoded duplicates introduced).
All user-facing labels remain in English.

file_operations.description: Confirm and (if needed) normalize the `siteContent.contact.phone` and `siteContent.contact.address` fields as the canonical, editable values (no additional duplicate constants for phone/address introduced).

Ensure the Address and Phone display continue to render strictly from `siteContent.contact.address` and `siteContent.contact.phone`, with no hardcoded fallback strings added; keep all labels in English.

requirements.summary: Remove hardcoded phone/address from the footer and render the “Visit Us” block using `siteContent.contact.address` and `siteContent.contact.phone`.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/components/SiteFooter.tsx` no longer contains hardcoded address/phone strings (e.g., "123 Main Street" or "(415) 555-0123").
Footer “Visit Us” displays the same phone/address as the Contact section, sourced from `frontend/src/content/siteContent.ts`.
No other footer content/regressions are introduced (quick links and branding still render).

file_operations.description: Import `siteContent` and replace the hardcoded “Visit Us” address/phone lines with renders from `siteContent.contact.address` and `siteContent.contact.phone`; preserve existing branding, quick links, and layout.
